intro: Czernaevia conioselinum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wormwood, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and narrow, gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
